verses.verse: (Obedience Better than Fasting) Now in the fourth year of King Darius it came to pass that the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, on the fourth day of the ninth month, Chislev,
when the people sent Sherezer, with Regem-Melech and his men, to the house of God, to pray before the LORD,

and to (Deut. 17:9; Mal. 2:7) ask the priests who were in the house of the LORD of hosts, and the prophets, saying, “Should I weep in (Zech. 8:19) the fifth month and fast as I have done for so many years?”
Then the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying,

“Say to all the people of the land, and to the priests: ‘When you ((Is. 58:1-9)) fasted and mourned in the fifth (Jer. 41:1) and seventh months (Zech. 1:12) during those seventy years, did you really fast ((Rom. 14:6)) for Me—for Me?
(Deut. 12:7; 14:26; 1 Chr. 29:22) When you eat and when you drink, do you not eat and drink for yourselves?

Should you not have obeyed the words which the LORD proclaimed through the (Is. 1:16-20; Jer. 7:5, 23; Zech. 1:4) former prophets when Jerusalem and the cities around it were inhabited and prosperous, and (Jer. 17:26) the South and the Lowland were inhabited?’ ”
(Disobedience Resulted in Captivity) Then the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, saying,
“Thus says the LORD of hosts: (Is. 58:6, 7; Jer. 7:28) ‘Execute true justice, Show mercy and compassion Everyone to his brother.

(Ex. 22:22; Ps. 72:4; Is. 1:17; Jer. 5:28) Do not oppress the widow or the fatherless, The alien or the poor. (Ps. 36:4; Ezek. 38:10; 45:9; Mic. 2:1; Zech. 8:16, 17) Let none of you plan evil in his heart Against his brother.’
“But they refused to heed, (Neh. 9:29) shrugged their shoulders, and (Jer. 17:23; Acts 7:57) stopped their ears so that they could not hear.

Yes, they made their (Ezek. 11:19) hearts like flint, (Neh. 9:29, 30) refusing to hear the law and the words which the LORD of hosts had sent by His Spirit through the former prophets. (2 Chr. 36:16; Dan. 9:11, 12) Thus great wrath came from the LORD of hosts.
Therefore it happened, that just as He proclaimed and they would not hear, so (Prov. 1:24-28; Is. 1:15; Jer. 11:11; Mic. 3:4) they called out and I would not listen,” says the LORD of hosts.

“But (Lev. 26:33; Deut. 4:27; 28:64; Neh. 1:8) I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations which they had not known. Thus the land became desolate after them, so that no one passed through or returned; for they made the pleasant land desolate.”
(Jerusalem, Holy City of the Future) Again the word of the LORD of hosts came, saying,
“Thus says the LORD of hosts: (Joel 2:18; Nah. 1:2; Zech. 1:14) ‘I am zealous for Zion with great zeal; With great fervor I am zealous for her.’

“Thus says the LORD: (Zech. 1:16) ‘I will return to Zion, And (Zech. 2:10, 11) dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. Jerusalem (Is. 1:21) shall be called the City of Truth, ((Is. 2:2, 3)) The Mountain of the LORD of hosts, (Jer. 31:23) The Holy Mountain.’
“Thus says the LORD of hosts: (1 Sam. 2:31; Is. 65:20) ‘Old men and old women shall again sit In the streets of Jerusalem, Each one with his staff in his hand Because of great age.
The streets of the city Shall be (Jer. 30:19, 20) full of boys and girls Playing in its streets.’
“Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, ((Gen. 18:14; Luke 1:37)) Will it also be marvelous in My eyes?’ Says the LORD of hosts.
“Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Behold, (Ps. 107:3; Is. 11:11; Ezek. 37:21) I will save My people from the land of the east And from the land of the west;

I will (Zeph. 3:20; Zech. 10:10) bring them back, And they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. ((Jer. 30:22; 31:1, 33; Zech. 13:9)) They shall be My people And I will be their God, (Jer. 4:2) In truth and righteousness.’

“Thus says the LORD of hosts: (1 Chr. 22:13; Is. 35:4; Hag. 2:4) ‘Let your hands be strong, You who have been hearing in these days These words by the mouth of (Ezra 5:1, 2; 6:14; Zech. 4:9) the prophets, Who spoke in (Hag. 2:18) the day the foundation was laid For the house of the LORD of hosts, That the temple might be built.
